Interface MovieDao

All Known Implementing Classes:
MysqlMovieDao
public interface MovieDao
Data Access Object (DAO) interface for the Movie entity.

This interface defines the CRUD contract used by all DAO implementations (e.g., MysqlMovieDao, SqliteMovieDao) for persistence operations.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide abstract methods for Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations.
  • Enforce a consistent API for working with Movie objects, independent of the database type.
  • Ensure compatibility with the schema where movie_id is a VARCHAR(10) primary key.

Author: Luis Augusto Monserratt Alvarado

Version: 1.0

  • Method Details

    • findAll

      List<Movie> findAll() throws SQLException
      Retrieves all movies from the database.
      Returns:
      a list of all Movie records in the table
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • findById

      Optional<Movie> findById(String id) throws SQLException
      Finds a single movie by its string primary key.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique movie identifier (e.g., "INT2010"); cannot be null or blank
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the matching movie, or empty if not found
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • insert

      Movie insert(Movie movie) throws SQLException
      Inserts a new Movie record into the database.
      Parameters:
      movie - the movie to insert (all required fields must be provided)
      Returns:
      the inserted movie instance
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs or constraints are violated

    • update

      boolean update(Movie movie) throws SQLException
      Updates an existing Movie record based on its primary key.
      Parameters:
      movie - the movie to update; must contain a valid primary key
      Returns:
      true if at least one row was updated; false if no match found
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • delete

      boolean delete(String id) throws SQLException
      Deletes a movie record by its string primary key.
      Parameters:
      id - the movie ID to delete (e.g., "INT2010")
      Returns:
      true if at least one row was deleted; false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs
